publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7078 Bill Kidd: Another Successful Year for Dumbarton Road Corridor Addiction Forum—That the Parliament offers its congratulations to Dumbarton Road Corridor (DRC) Addiction Forum on what it considers another successful year of activity and the publication of its 2009-10 annual report; welcomes that the forum was one of many organisations across Scotland increasing opportunities for young people to benefit from Scottish Government CashBack for Communities funds; further congratulates the DRC Addiction Forum Peer Educators on winning the Evening Times Community Championship Award in the last year; commends all the volunteers and staff for their dedication and hard work in making a real difference to the lives of DRC Addiction Forum service users, and wishes them all continuing success in the coming year and beyond.

S3M-7078 Bill Kidd: Another Successful Year for Dumbarton Road Corridor Addiction Forum—That the Parliament offers its congratulations to Dumbarton Road Corridor (DRC) Addiction Forum on what it considers another successful year of activity and the publication of its 2009-10 annual report; welcomes that the forum was one of many organisations across Scotland increasing opportunities for young people to benefit from Scottish Government CashBack for Communities funds; further congratulates the DRC Addiction Forum Peer Educators on winning the Evening Times Community Championship Award in the last year; commends all the volunteers and staff for their dedication and hard work in making a real difference to the lives of DRC Addiction Forum service users, and wishes them all continuing success in the coming year and beyond. Supported by: Aileen Campbell*, Kenneth Gibson*, Bill Butler*, Sandra White*, Gil Paterson*, Maureen Watt*
S3M-7078 Another Successful Year for Dumbarton Road Corridor Addiction Forum (lodged on 23 September 2010) Bill Aitken*
S3M-7078 Another Successful Year for Dumbarton Road Corridor Addiction Forum (lodged on 23 September 2010) Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-7078 Another Successful Year for Dumbarton Road Corridor Addiction Forum (lodged on 23 September 2010) Angela Constance*
